citation.article-title: Lactobacillus durianis sp. nov., isolated from an acid-fermented condiment (tempoyak) in Malaysia.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus durianis sp. nov.
Lactobacillus durianis (du.ri.an'is. N.L. adj. durianis of the durian fruit)
Cells are Gram-positive, non-motile and non-sporeforming rods occurring singly, as pairs or in chains (fewer than five cells) in APT broth supplemented with glucose, D-xylose or both components.
Surface colonies on APT agar with D-xylose or glucose after 3 days of micro-aerophilic incubation at 30 °C are 1 mm or less in diameter, round and with smooth surfaces.
The colonies are smaller with glucose than with D-xylose (growth is enhanced by replacing glucose with D-xylose).
Catalase-negative.
Nitrate is not reduced.
NH3 is not produced from arginine.
The species is obligately heterofermentative.
Gas is produced from gluconic acid but not from glucose.
D(-)- and L-(­+)-lactic acid and acetic acid are produced from both glucose and D-xylose.
None of the three strains reduces tetrazolium on SBM agar, nor do they grow in Clark & Lubbs broth used in the Voges-Proskauer test.
Able to grow on acetate agar but unable to acidify Lα-broth below pH 4.15.
Growth occurs for all three strains in APT broth with glucose at temperatures ranging from 15 to 42°C.
With D-xylose, growth is observed from 10 to 42°C for strains LMG 19195 and LMG 19196 and from 15 to 42°C for strain LMG19193T.No growth in the presence of 6.5 or 8% NaCl.
Resistant towards 30 μg vancomycin g-1.

All three strains are able to produce acid from only a few of the carbohydrates in the API 50 CH kit, including L-arabinose, gluconate (weak reaction), 5-ketogluconate (weak reaction), maltose, ribose, D-xylose and methyl β-xyloside.

Two of the strains (LMG 19193T and LMG 19196) are also able to produce acid from D-glucose and D-lyxose and to hydrolyse aesculin or (LMG 19193T and LMG 19195) to produce acid from galactose and D-arabinose.
One strain (LMG 19193T) produces acid from starch (weak reaction) and another strain (LMG 19196) produces acid from D-arabitol.

No acid is produced from adonitol, amygdalin, arbutin, L-arabitol, cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, fructose, D-fucose, L-fucose, gentiobiose, 2-ketogluconate, N-acetyl glucosamine, methyl α-D-glucoside, glycerol, glycogen, inositol, inulin, lactose, mannitol, mannose, methyl α-D-mannoside, melibiose, melizitose, D-raffinose, rhamnose, salicin, sorbitol, L-sorbose, sucrose, D-tagatose, trehalose, D-turanose, xylitol or L-xylose.
The DNA G+C content is 43.2-43.3 mol%.
Features that differentiate L. durianis from other obligately heterofermentative Lactobacillus species are listed in Table 1.
Isolated from aMalaysian acid-fermented condiment, tempoyak, made from the durian fruit.
The type strain is LMG 19193T (=CCUG 45405T).
